alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Essex; Middlesex; Norfolk; Plymouth; Suffolk; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 3:48PM EDT until July 16 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN WORCESTER, NORFOLK, SUFFOLK, SOUTHERN ESSEX, EASTERN MIDDLESEX, NORTHWESTERN BRISTOL AND NORTHWESTERN PLYMOUTH COUNTIES... At 348 PM EDT, local law enforcement, radar and gage observations indicated thunderstorms having produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Rainfall rates have lightened from earlier excessive levels, however additional heavy rains are expected to resume in the next hour to 90 minutes as rain and embedded thunderstorms will move northeastward into the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring, and worsened or new areas of flooding are anticipated. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported Central St in Stoughton is flooded and impassable. A car was stuck in floodwaters in Lynnfield, and a portion of Pleasant St in Norwood is flooded. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Sharp rises on smaller creeks and streams in the warned area are likely and may rise over bankfull. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Boston, Cambridge, Brockton, Quincy, Lynn, Newton, Somerville, Framingham, Waltham, Malden, Brookline, Medford, Weymouth, Revere, Peabody, Arlington, Everett, Salem, Billerica and Beverly. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Bristol; Essex; Middlesex; Norfolk; Plymouth; Suffolk; Worcester
